reviews.review_text: The café is renowned for its delectable breakfast options, including Western-style eggs, sandwiches, and crepes. Coffee enthusiasts will appreciate the quality of their brews, and the thick milkshakes are equally delightful. Baked goods such as sourdough and country loaves are made in-house and have garnered a loyal following. Regular patrons also look forward to treats like dark chocolate cranberry cookies, cinnamon buns, and chocolate almond banana muffins. The Basque cheesecake is particularly noteworthy.

Together with a friend we called in here for breakfast on our way to Agonda from Calangute.
We both decided on Eggs Benedict with Roast Beef. Being from England we thought that this was an odd combination but it works beautifully and tastes amazing.
2 days later on our return journey I opted for something different...a cheese mushroom and spinach omlette. Cooked and prepared to perfection with amazing flavours.
We both ordered the thick salted caramel shake...ummmmm yummy.
Please visit this amazing place you will not be disappointed.
We cant wait to come back next year.
A fantastic ambience with great music playing in the background.
Staff friendly and very helpful.

A great spot for continental food in a laid-back, relaxed setting—ideal for meetings or working on your laptop. The semi-open space offers plenty of room to park and walk around, adding to the overall comfortable vibe.

Food we tried:-
• Eggs Benedict: Absolutely fantastic, served with spinach and mushrooms. The eggs were incredibly fresh, and the poaching was done to perfection. I loved it.
• Double Smash Cheeseburger: Delicious and highly recommended if you’re craving a classic burger.
• Mushroom Cheddar Toastie: Perfectly crispy and well-toasted; truly delightful.
• Eggplant Schnitzel: My friend ordered this and thoroughly enjoyed it, flavorful and well-prepared.
• Chicken tatos with pineapple Salsa: Kinda off soft taco, made from roti. Taste is good and salsa is refreshing.
• Iced Americano: Paired perfectly with our meal, providing a refreshing kick.
• Caramel salted shake: Perfect drink as a dessert, home style and taste.

Overall, it's a great place for a lazy Sunday brunch, offering both excellent food and a welcoming ambiance.
